title: How to Decline a Phone Call with a Text Message

steps.title: Know your options when a call comes in.
steps.content: Know your options when a call comes in. When you receive an incoming call, a circle appears on the incoming call screen. Look closely at the options available surrounding that circle, and you’ll see that you need not be flustered. Normally, to answer a call, you would slide the circle to the right side of the screen, and to reject the call, you would slide the circle to the left side of the screen. The other option available is to decline the call with a text message.

steps.title: Drag the circle to the messaging icon and let go.
steps.content: Drag the circle to the messaging icon and let go. When you can’t take a call, dragging the circle to the messaging icon and letting go will let you send a quick text message, which can either be pre-written or created on the spot.

steps.title: Select an appropriate reply from the pre-written messages.
steps.content: Select an appropriate reply from the pre-written messages. You can also choose the “Custom” option to create a text message (that is, when none of the pre-written messages will do). Your selection of a pre-written text message will automatically decline the incoming call by sending the text message to the caller. Creating custom messages and clicking on the Send button will also decline the call.

steps.title: Open the Phone application from your apps menu.
steps.content: Open the Phone application from your apps menu. The Phone app can be found in your App Drawer and is represented by a phone icon.

steps.title: Tap on the Menu button.
steps.content: Tap on the Menu button. It’s the button represented by three horizontal bars, and found at the bottom right or bottom left corner of the phone screen.

steps.title: Tap on Call Settings.
steps.content: Tap on Call Settings. You should be able to find it under Settings. In some Android devices, Call Settings can also be categorized under “Other Settings.”

steps.title: Select the Quick Responses option.
steps.content: Select the Quick Responses option. Here, you will find the list of pre-written short messages.

steps.title: Select the message you wish to edit.
steps.content: Select the message you wish to edit. Edit the selected text message according to your preferences. You can include a greeting at the start of the message if you wish, just to make the message sound a bit more friendly.

steps.title: Save the edited message.
steps.content: Save the edited message. Simply click on “OK” or “Done” to save the edited pre-written text message.
